title: Sump - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Support the motorcycle on its side stand with access to the sump.
Place an oil drain pan beneath the engine.
Remove the three sump plugs from the bottom of the sump and allow the engine oil to drain. Discard the washers.
Support the motorcycle in an up right position with access to the sump.
Release the five fixings and position the radiator lower surround bracket to one side.
Note the routing of the brake line and the coolant expansion tank drain hose for installation.
Release the fixings and remove the rear

body.name: Rear brake line bracket YB1; YK1; YL1 B00142

body.body: Release the fixings and remove the rear brake line front bracket.

body.name: Rear brake line front bracket B00177_1

body.body: Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency causing loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Note the position of the rider's right hand control plate for installation.
Always return the rider control plates to their original positions. Operating the motorcycle with the control plates in a position which is unfamiliar may lead to loss of control or an accident.
Release the fixings and detach the rider right hand control plate from the engine. support the control plate to prevent damage to the brake lines.
For the sump there are, twenty six M6 x30 mm, two M6 x 130 mm and five M6 x 50 mm fixings.
The M6 x 50 mm fixings are encapsulated and must be replaced if loosened or removed.
Note the position of the fixings for installation.
Note the positions of the dowels for installation.
Release the fixings in the sequence shown and remove the sump. Remove and discard the sump gasket and the five M6 x 50mm fixings.
If required, release the fixings securing the baffle plate and the retaining plate for the pick up filter. Discard the fixings.
Note the orientation of the baffle plate, the two oil strainers and their O-rings for installation.
Note the orientation of the oil pick-up and its retaining plate filter for installation.
Remove the baffle plate and the filters for cleaning.
Clean the surfaces of the crankcase and the sump cover using a lint free cloth.
